title: Six spooky Zlatan coincidences with number ‚Äò17‚Äô
text:
Source: FOX SPORTS ZLATAN Ibrahimovic may need to change his shirt number to ‚Äò17‚Äô. 
Today he scored his 17th hat-trick (his first for Manchester United), his 17th goal against St Etienne, and his 17th goal or assist on his 17th appearance at Old Trafford. 
If that wasn‚Äôt strange enough, it was all on the February 17, 2017 (AEDT). 
You wouldn‚Äôt have been able to predict any of those crazy coincidences - not at the start of the season and not even before the start of Manchester United‚Äôs 3-0 Europa League Round of 32 win over the French side. 
The match was billed as the battle of the Pogbas, with the Red Devils‚Äô world-record signing Paul taking on his older brother Florentin, but it was the big Swede who stole the headlines. 
But out of the 35-year-old‚Äôs 13th trebles scored at club level (along with four for Sweden), this may have been his easiest ever. This is scary. Feb 17, 2017: Zlatan scores his 17th treble, 17th goal v St Etienne and his 17th goal/assist in 17 Old Trafford appearances üò≤ pic.twitter.com/cA4Nn2Lisu ‚Äî FOX SPORTS Football (@FOXFootballLive) February 16, 2017 
After 15 minutes his low free kick somehow dribbled through the St Etienne defence and into the wall. 
His second goal an hour later was a simple tap in, and then he won a penalty with a couple minutes to play. No prizes for guessing who was going to take the spot-kick. 
No doubt, Ibrahimovic has silenced all of his critics twice over with his 23rd goal of the season, and 56th in European competition for his career. 
‚ÄúThere was a question mark over him playing in the Premier League,‚Äù said former Manchester United and Sydney FC striker Dwight Yorke after the match. Zlatan gifted by St Etienne 0:41 
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs shown why he‚Äôs such a class act. He‚Äôs brought back personality into the football club. 
‚ÄúHe walks the walk. He‚Äôs doing that consistently and it‚Äôs turning out to be a more than impressive season for him.‚Äù 
But Ibrahimovic played down the win afterwards. 
‚ÄúWe created good chances. It was important to get a good win at home. It was a good game but I think we can do better,‚Äù Ibrahimovic told BT Sport. 
‚ÄúWe are winning but in a short time everything can change. It‚Äôs important to keep getting the wins we need. Everything can change but we‚Äôre happy at the moment.‚Äù 3 - Zlatan Ibrahimovic has scored his first Manchester United hat-trick. Treble. pic.twitter.com/bA986bKv0G
